image.altText: A polystyrene beehive with the lid off showing frames with bees inside.

props.synopsis: Victor Croker and Dave Leemhuis struggled to keep their bees alive during winter so they developed a new insulated hive. It's proved so popular among beekeepers that 500 are now being shipped to the United States each week.

title.children: These beekeepers created a new type of hive that's so popular they're shipping 500 to the US each week

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old man has been jailed for a dramatic attack and robbery with two others, after the victim recognised him because they'd been to school together.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for over two years for 'cowardly' unprovoked robbery

image.altText: A man sings passionately into a with a drummer behind him playing.

props.synopsis: Changes to noise restrictions which will allow sounds of up to 75 decibels until 1am over the weekend in the city have been wholeheartedly embraced by the live music sector in Canberra.

title.children: 'Fun is not silent': Live entertainment noise limits in city relaxed significantly

image.altText: A sitting dog looks up at the camera.

props.synopsis: Oakley, the six-year-old border collie, is a conservation detection dog who sniffs out noxious alligator weed in Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Conservation detection dog Oakley having a ball patrolling Lake Burley Griffin for invasive weed

image.altText: A prototype of a lunar rover, with big black wheels, a gold body and a panel on the side.

props.synopsis: An Australian-made rover called Roo-ver will be part of an upcoming NASA mission to the Moon to help extract oxygen and metals from lunar soil.

title.children: Could this prototype become Australia's first Moon rover?

image.altText: A copy of Mem Fox's book Where is the Green Sheep? stands alongside copies of its commemorative coin.

props.synopsis: Classic children's book written by Mem Fox and illustrated by Judy Horacek gets commemorated on 20-cent coin.

title.children: Where is the green sheep? On a 20-cent coin

image.altText: A male choir rehearses. There are two lines of men, with one line standing on a stop behind the others.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Men's Choir is an "awesome fellowship" and no auditions are required.

title.children: Retirement can be a 'trap' for men. So these blokes joined a choir

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest bank is blacklisting fossil fuel companies that can't show genuine efforts to reduce emissions, putting pressure on other finance institutions to follow suit.

title.children: 'The writing's on the wall': Australia's largest mortgage lender sets the tone after ditching climate culprits

image.altText: Peter Dutton sits in a chair on the floor of parliament, separate from his colleagues.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader's capacity to conflate a range of hot button issues, half-truths and misleading assertions is only matched by the federal government's often flat-footed capacity to respond.

title.children: Peter Dutton's calls to ban refugees from Gaza have proved too much for some MPs

image.altText: Greens Senator for WA Dorinda Cox in a black shirt that says stop killing women.

props.synopsis: Families of missing and murdered women had already told their traumas to coroners, magistrates, journalists and police officers. Was a procedural Senate inquiry — bound by time and budget constraints — ever going to be any different?

title.children: Families of murdered Aboriginal women have told their trauma for decades. Was a Senate inquiry ever going to bring change?

image.altText: Satellite image shows a new series of defensive trenches.

props.synopsis: Since Ukrainian troops staged a surprise cross-border attack into Russia's Kursk region early last week, Kyiv claims to now control more than 1,100 square kilometres of territory. This is how the incursion is tracking.

title.children: Maps and satellite images show Ukraine's gains as incursion grows in Russian territory

image.altText: Two greyhounds at an outdoor event.

props.synopsis: Queensland's embattled racing integrity commission is facing a secret probe from independent investigators, with former staff making allegations of bullying, sexual harassment, suspect hiring practices and excessive expenditure, the ABC has confirmed.

title.children: Racing integrity body faces secret probe by external investigators

image.altText: a headshot of a man with grey hair and glasses smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Allegedly dodgy doctors teamed up with an LA dealer known as the "Ketamine Queen" and the Friends' star's personal assistant to use his addiction issues to "enrich themselves", US authorities say after charging five people following a wide-ranging investigation.

title.children: 'I wonder how much this moron will pay': Inside the ketamine ring that fuelled Matthew Perry's addiction

image.altText: A burnt out car sits in the middle of a street with a man filming on a phone behind it

props.synopsis: Israel's prime minister and other cabinet members said the group of 100 settlers who set fire to homes and cars in the West Bank village of Jit would be held to account.

title.children: Israeli leaders issue rare condemnation of settler attacks in West Bank

image.altText: An aerial shot of a city skyline in the distance, with houses and parklands in the foreground

props.synopsis: An increase in supply, a decrease in overseas migration and share housing could be the reason the rental market is at last beginning to slow.

title.children: Australia's red hot rental market is at last starting to cool

image.altText: Several people walking on a road, including some holding signs. One sign reads "Tourist go home"

props.synopsis: Barcelona draws millions of tourists every year, and while the city needs their cash, many residents have had enough and are taking action, arguing the influx of visitors is unsustainable.

title.children: Barcelona has a plan to ease its rental crisis, and tourists won't like it

image.altText: An older woman wearing a party hat celebrates in front of some colourful streamers

props.synopsis: The most controversial thing I could possibly suggest about ageing is that it has almost nothing to with physiology and absolutely everything to do with attitude.

title.children: Over another birthday martini, I'm calling it: Ageing is all about attitude

image.altText: Boys at school

props.synopsis: It's an industry that emerged from a parental ambition to provide the best education for one's kids. But there are concerns about the quality of tutoring services and child protection — and experts want greater regulation.

title.children: Families can spend upwards of $20,000 a year on tutoring. The benefit for students is unclear

image.altText: Jayson Gillham takes a bow standing next to a piano while orchestra members behind him applause

props.synopsis: Musicians at the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra have expressed a vote of no confidence in the managing director, after the cancellation of a performance by a pianist who spoke about the conflict in Gaza.

title.children: Musicians vote no confidence in MSO following concert cancellation over Gaza comments

image.altText: Female athletes at the CrossFit Games taking as knee in tribute of the late Lazar Dukic

props.synopsis: Members of the Australian CrossFit community say they are reeling following the death of a competitor during an event at the CrossFit Games in the United States, with athletes starting to question the safety of the competition.

title.children: Is CrossFit pushing competitors too far? Australian athletes question competition safety following death at 2024 games

image.altText: Two people watching the sunset in the Antarctic.

props.synopsis: Economists estimate there are up to 400,000 "super commuters" in Australia travelling extreme distances, including overseas, for dream jobs or high-paying work in locations like Alaska and Antarctica.

title.children: 'One day I can be in Kazakhstan, the next day in Korea': Meet Australia's 'mega commuters'

image.altText: A composite of two images of Orpheus, one from 2018 and one from 2024.

props.synopsis: In 2018, Orpheus Pledger was well on his way to stardom and success. Six years on, he has now been sentenced to jail.

title.children: Six years ago, his star was on the rise. Now, the tables have turned for Orpheus Pledger

image.altText: A woman holding her toddler son's hand walk through a car parking garage that is about half empty.

props.synopsis: Urban planners say Australia has too much parking. But as car ownership grows, questions have surfaced as to whether we could ever build less.

title.children: Jennifer lives in the middle of Melbourne where parking is scarce — but there's plenty available in her garage

image.altText: A young Aboriginal teen, Telaya, stares at the camera smiling. She wears a black jumper, the orange track behind her.

props.synopsis: Just weeks before the Paralympics begin, four First Nations Paralympians have been announced in the squad. We hear from the youngest competitor.

title.children: Paris-bound Paralympics teen shares her drive

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: A shortage of IV fluids will last until at least the end of this year, as health ministers agree to meet weekly on the issue while critical supply constraints remain.

title.children: IV fluid shortage will remain for the rest of 2024, but health ministers urge calm

image.altText: Rebecca Talbot smiling with a dog on a couch with children around

props.synopsis: A $20 million donation from philanthropist Kay Van Norton Poche is helping to bring world-class cancer clinical trials to Australia.

title.children: 'I just wouldn't be here by now': Life-saving cancer clinical trial hub opens in Sydney after $20m donation

image.altText: Balinese wearing traditional clothes dance during Balinese arts festival in Denpasar

props.synopsis: Did you know that the Dutch once traded the swampy island of Manhattan to the British for an island in Indonesia? Take this quiz to learn more about Indonesia, as the country celebrates its 79th Independence Day.

title.children: So you've been to Bali, but how much do you really know about Indonesia?

image.altText: A grey-scale image of a small crustacean.

props.synopsis: When a UK palaeontologist examined rocks collected from rural west England in the 1990s, he found something unexpected: a tiny fossil with a perfectly preserved penis.

title.children: 'It's very rare that you can gender fossils': How scientists discovered a 425-million-year-old penis

image.altText: Spencer Porter

props.synopsis: The liquidator of a tiny home business believes the company may have been trading insolvent for almost one year, saying the director had "no real prospect" of supplying the product he sold.

title.children: 'Foolish' business model led to collapse of tiny homes company that owes Australians millions, liquidator says

image.altText: Three soldiers wearing Ukranian military gear pose with guns next to vehicle

props.synopsis: Ukraine's top commander says Kyiv has set up a military office in the occupied part of Russia's Kursk region.

title.children: Ukraine says it has full control of Russian town Sudzha

image.altText: A view from above of a city on the coast with a shipping port

props.synopsis: Haifa lives with the vivid memory of being hit with rockets. It's taking unique steps to keep safe.

title.children: Burrowing underground — the world's largest fortified hospital lying in wait if Hezbollah attacks Israel

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone while gesturing with both hands.

props.synopsis: As Kamala Harris pulls ahead of the former president in the polls, an increasing number of Republicans are urging their nominee to change tack or risk losing in November.

title.children: Republicans are warning Donald Trump to dial down the personal attacks. Here's why he's refusing

image.altText: Harvester in a wheat crop

props.synopsis: Agribusiness analysts with decades of experience in the industry say they have never seen farmland price growth like the past five years.

title.children: Think housing prices are rising quickly? Not compared to farmland

image.altText: Tonia sits next to a chimp who peers at her from its glass enclosure. She has blonde hair and wears a pink t-shirt.

props.synopsis: From your next exotic animal docuseries obsession to Jeff Goldblum as a god in KAOS, here are five series that are new, good and out this month.

title.children: The newest bizarre documentary from the makers of Tiger King is here — this time it's about chimps
